ISSUE.TITLE: The --ml-backends command line option does not do anything
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: **Describe the bug** The `--ml-backends` option does not do anything. **To Reproduce** I tried passing the flag to both `init` and `start` and the UI shows no ML backends. **Additional context** The code to handle this argument seems to have completely disappeared during the 1.0.0 release (commit 6ec1e79e0ff5b6b3fc033d00dad5ccb6b9f014b4, it's a large code dump, you can search/grep for `args.ml_backends` in `git show 6ec1e79e0ff5b6b3fc033d00dad5ccb6b9f014b4` in a local checkout).

BUGGYCOMMIT.MESSAGE: update CORS guidance Update CORS guidance per issue #1013 and fixed a couple broken links

COMMIT.MESSAGE: Remove/deprecate ml-backends command Per issue #996, the ml-backends command is actually deprecated and doesn't work. Updating the documentation accordingly.

Doc updates and fixes (#1040) * Update image_units.md Updating to remove an error that max discovered * Update page.ejs Updating slack footer formatting that got bungled when I was fixing merge conflicts, sigh * update CORS guidance Update CORS guidance per issue #1013 and fixed a couple broken links * Remove/deprecate ml-backends command Per issue #996, the ml-backends command is actually deprecated and doesn't work. Updating the documentation accordingly. * Update install_enterprise.md Update for customer issue encountered when logging in * Add result and region ID info add info about result and region IDs * Fix misspell * Update page.styl Fixing typo * Delete annotation_ids.md Removing for now, will put in another PR Co-authored-by: makseq-ubnt <makseq@gmail.com>
